job_title: PGY1 Pharmacy Resident in Erie, PA
pros: Pharmacy integrated medicine that allows for deeper connection with patients, nurses, staff, and physicians
cons: long hours, weather is awful

pros:
Autonomy in decision making within settings, but no guidance on decision making and no support from management. 
Current Practice Manager tries hardest and genuinely cares, but has no back up from other management. 
Copays and deductibles are written off for employees if use in-system providers. 
Good for base experience to move on to a higher paying job with another company.
cons: Nepotism is basis for pay raises and advancing. No support, upper level management provides no help or support, no guidance. Employees are often ignored for questions/concerns. Job training is non-existent- other poorly trained staff training new hirees and video training. Wages are poor and expectations are high. Communication is the absolute worst.

pros: Free food for dietary workers
cons: Poor management. No help from HR. HR is ran by young girls with no experience. Upper management is corrupted and are very full of themselves. Will not talk to anybody who is of lower status than they are. You are expected to work off the clock which is illegal. Everyone says it's like a family there which is terrible because then you are expected to commit parts of your life outside of work to work. You can never escape it.

review_title: DO NOT WORK AT MILLCREEK COMMUNITY HOSPITAL!

cons: - Unprofessional management - Lazy staff - Inappropriate patient admissions

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Erie, PA
pros: Hours, flexible scheduling, free meals on weekends
cons: Presence and support of management

review_title: Feels like the good old days before huge conglomerate hospital corporations
pros: Parking is great. The people in HR are nice...all the time. Housekeeping does a good job keeping the place looking clean and neat. The cafeteria is cheap and the food is good. The food service employees are always nice. They hire real police for security and they are pleasant and visable, not hiding in a room just watching security camera tv. All the departments are small enough that it's easy to get to know at least 2 people from all of them. They have many special employee events in the cafeteria, free breakfast buffets with welcoming new doctors, free meals for holidays and hospital week. Upper management is visable and involved with employee engagement activities as well as daily hospital operations. The benefits are great. No I mean seriously GREAT. Blue cross premium is so low it's less than half of what it is at the local bayside hospital conglomerate. And any in network or in hospital copay is 0. You come get your bloodwork and x ray here, you pay 0. Come to the ER for 6 stitches and a tetanus shot, pay 0. On the all,  people are friendly and nice to work with. I don't have anxiety attacks on my way to work anymore.  I am actually happy to not be having my soul sucked out of me.
cons: Middle management could use more help, many seem stretched thin. Pay is biweekly. Some things are not the latest and greatest technology wise but do the job just the same.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Erie, PA
pros: Nice coworkers, good connections with patients, can feel like you're making a difference
cons: Absolutely dangerous, horrible communication between staff, managers do not connect with staff

review_title: Millcreek Community Hospital is one of the worst places to work, even the employees wont get FREE health care there!
pros:
Meeting the nice patients and getting to make them smile everyday.
free ER visits to their hospital
cons:
NEVER enough staff always doing the work of 2-3 people and you HAD to finish your work before you left and if you wernt done before your shift ended you had to clock out and THEN finish!! which was usually an hour later.
asked to do illegal practices
turn over rate is horrible 
90% of doctors there are still in school learning

pros: Excellent benefits and retirement plan, small hospital.  Hospital census mostly psychiatric and detox.  Lots of outpatient surgery.  Being small in size keeps it friendly and cozy maybe.  Part of the largest census medical school in the country, LECOM (Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine.
cons: Too many chiefs, people in charge or overseeing not qualified; being small if you know someone you can get what you want.  Sometimes tough getting vacation you want.  Not much room for advancement.

review_title: Unfair practices by unit management and HR
pros: Most coworkers were very friendly.
cons: the hardest working ppl get the least amount of pay and are generally treated poorly by other coworkers because of job status. MCH is the only place I have ever worked where people talk about you behind your back constantly about things that are nobody else's business. Some managers are very unprofessional by doing this in my opinion.

review_title: Best to look elsewhere for employment
pros: Some departments are really close and work as a team
cons: Salary is low, equipment is old, employees and management openly gossip about other people, lack of teamwork.

pros: The people. I made a lot of friends there. The pay was not that great. Hard work, But I did feel appreciated. Overall a good experience for me.
cons: The pay could have been better. I worked extremely hard for it.

pros: Smaller Hospitol better for department and co workers
